extendedIngredients.name: heirloom tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 heirloom tomatoes (or I used half of four different-colored heirlooms), cored and thinly sliced
metaInformation: (or I used half of four different-colored heirlooms)

extendedIngredients.name: onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: quarter of a red onion, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: peaches
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 ripe peaches, cored and thinly sliced

recipes.title: Heirloom Tomato & Peach Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Salad can be paired with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: Combine the tomatoes, peaches and red onion in a bowl and toss with the basil, olive oil and vinegar until evenly mixed. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate up to two days.

steps.step: Combine the tomatoes, peaches and red onion in a bowl and toss with the basil, olive oil and vinegar until evenly mixed.
Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate up to two days.
